Member Function Documentation

double ExpAngleMetric::dist ( const Matrix &  M,
int  col1Ix,
int  col2Ix 
) const [virtual]

Compute a distance metric between two columns of a matrix.

Note that the indexes are *1* based (not 0) as that is Newmat's convention. Note that dist(M,i,j) must equal dist(M,j,i);

In this case the distnance metric is the exponated 1 - cosine of the angle between the two vectors, this is also sometimes known as the uncentered correlation coefficient and is similar to correlation except that it requires the length of the vectors to be the same for cos(x,y) to be 1.

If x and y are vectors then: Where: Where the numerator is the dot product of x and y.

Parameters:
M - Matrix whose columns represent individual items to be clustered.
col1Ix - Column index to be compared (1 based).
col2Ix - Column index to be compared (1 based).
Returns:
- "Distance" or "dissimilarity" metric between two columns of matrix.

Reimplemented from AngleMetric.
